title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to email templates.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7909
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pw2f-m22m-p75c
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Pimcore before 6.2.2 lacks brute force protection for the 2FA token.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-18985
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/9f2d075243a8392c114d9a8028858b9faf041e2d
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/compare/v6.2.1...v6.2.2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hf62-5vxh-jpwj
items.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Pimcore 2FA Vulnerable to Brute Forcing

items.content_html:
A vulnerability was found in Moodle versions 3.7.x before 3.7.3, 3.6.x before 3.6.7 and 3.5.x before 3.5.9. When a cohort role assignment was removed, the associated capabilities were not being revoked (where applicable).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-14879
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-14879
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/7b5f4a62c18fd5bad6956828aade23e1f15b4be3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g9m2-c2x5-fr2v
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle does not revoke role capabilities correctly

items.content_html:
A stored-self XSS exists in Croogo allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable Title field to /admin/taxonomy/vocabularies.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7170
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/890
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/commit/cafaaabe2cef3d1d83652370e30563e6ad7c4158
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-36pq-cjh9-fv46
items.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.9.0. A vulnerability was found that allows an attacker to trigger a CSRF attack against a phpMyAdmin user. The attacker can trick the user, for instance through a broken <img> tag pointing at the victim's phpMyAdmin database, and the attacker can potentially deliver a payload (such as a specific INSERT or DELETE statement) to the victim.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-12616
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2019-4/
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/015c404038c44279d95b6430ee5a0dddc97691ec
  • https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153251/phpMyAdmin-4.8-Cross-Site-Request-Forgery.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mfr9-pcm3-6mwc
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CSRF Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in Moodle before 3.7, 3.6.4, 3.5.6, 3.4.9 and 3.1.18. The form to upload cohorts contained a redirect field, which was not restricted to internal URLs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10133
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-10133
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=386523
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/c509d108216524887c7ca08b1c451054d669ea75
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5xp2-rv4h-mm2q
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Open Redirect Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A defense-in-depth check was added to mitigate inadequate session validation handling by 3rd party checkout modules. This impacts Magento 1.x prior to 1.9.4.2, Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9 and Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7849
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v797-hfv8-v2xm
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Session Fixation Check

items.content_html:
A defense-in-depth check was added to mitigate inadequate session validation handling by 3rd party checkout modules. This impacts Magento 1.x prior to 1.9.4.2, Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9 and Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

References

  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v797-hfv8-v2xm

items.content_html:
Shopware before 5.5.8 has XSS via the Query String to the backend/Login or backend/Login/load/ URI.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-12935
  • https://www.netsparker.com/web-applications-advisories/ns-19-004-cross-site-scripting-in-shopware/
  • https://www.shopware.com/en/changelog/#5-5-8
  • http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Jun/32
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8qxh-hcr9-2379
items.title: [shopware/shopware] Shopware Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A cross-site request forgery vulnerability exists in the GiftCardAccount removal feature for Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7947
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w392-68rg-pgg4
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition CSRF vulnerability
